dt: {bc}marked by, involved in, or belonging to {a_link|ceremony} {bc}stressing careful attention to form and detail

pt: {sc}ceremonial{/sc} {sc}ceremonious{/sc} {sc}formal{/sc} {sc}conventional{/sc} mean marked by attention to or adhering strictly to prescribed forms. {sc}ceremonial{/sc} and {sc}ceremonious{/sc} both imply strict attention to what is prescribed by custom or by ritual, but {sc}ceremonial{/sc} applies to things that are associated with ceremonies
, {sc}ceremonious{/sc} to persons given to ceremony or to acts attended by ceremony.
{sc}formal{/sc} applies both to things prescribed by and to persons obedient to custom and may suggest stiff, restrained, or old-fashioned behavior.
{sc}conventional{/sc} implies accord with general custom and usage
and may suggest a stodgy lack of originality or independence.

shortdef: marked by, involved in, or belonging to ceremony : stressing careful attention to form and detail
having no real power or influence
